intro: Pavonia polymorpha, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bright red flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in open fields and along roadsides. Its rapid growth and distinctive appearance make it a notable wildflower in its native habitat.
